channel.title: Comments on: MySQL Cluster Manager 1.1.2 – creating a Cluster is now trivial
channel.description: Database technologies - especially around scalability and High Availability

item.title: By: Pedro
item.dc:creator: Pedro
item.description:
How can I solve this problem?
MySQL Cluster Manager 1.2.4 (64bit) started Connect to MySQL Cluster Manager by running "/opt/mcm-1.2.4/bin/mcm" -a desenv-linux2:1862 Configuring default cluster 'mycluster'... ERROR: Unable to create site, aborting bootstrap! ERROR 2004: (00MGR) Host desenv-linux2 is not a member of site mysite
file log:
Starting xcom thread on port 18620 2013-12-13 12:19:47.184: (message) MySQL Cluster Manager 1.2.4 (64bit) started 2013-12-13 12:19:47.184: (message) [T0x1ed5280 CMGR ]: Starting recovery 2013-12-13 12:19:47.184: (message) [T0x1ed5280 CMGR ]: Cluster Manager thread started 2013-12-13 12:19:47.186: (message) [T0x1ebf010 chass]: Listening for client connections on desenv-linux2:1862 2013-12-13 12:19:47.186: (message) [T0x7fe4700021c0 BOOT ]: Starting bootstrap thread 2013-12-13 12:19:47.245: (message) [T0x1ed5240 XCOM ]: Recovery completed 2013-12-13 12:19:47.307: (message) [T0x1ebf010 chass]: Received command : create site --hosts=desenv-linux2 mysite 2013-12-13 12:19:47.313: (message) [T0x1ebf010 chass]: Handling request id 1 2013-12-13 12:19:47.313: (critical) network-mysqld.c:2043: left the MySQL protocol's state-machine at state 'CON_STATE_READ_QUERY'. You may see the connection hang now.
item.content:encoded:
How can I solve this problem?

MySQL Cluster Manager 1.2.4 (64bit) started
Connect to MySQL Cluster Manager by running “/opt/mcm-1.2.4/bin/mcm” -a desenv-linux2:1862
Configuring default cluster ‘mycluster’…
ERROR: Unable to create site, aborting bootstrap!
ERROR 2004: (00MGR) Host desenv-linux2 is not a member of site mysite

file log:

Starting xcom thread on port 18620
2013-12-13 12:19:47.184: (message) MySQL Cluster Manager 1.2.4 (64bit) started
2013-12-13 12:19:47.184: (message) [T0x1ed5280 CMGR ]: Starting recovery
2013-12-13 12:19:47.184: (message) [T0x1ed5280 CMGR ]: Cluster Manager thread started
2013-12-13 12:19:47.186: (message) [T0x1ebf010 chass]: Listening for client connections on desenv-linux2:1862
2013-12-13 12:19:47.186: (message) [T0x7fe4700021c0 BOOT ]: Starting bootstrap thread
2013-12-13 12:19:47.245: (message) [T0x1ed5240 XCOM ]: Recovery completed
2013-12-13 12:19:47.307: (message) [T0x1ebf010 chass]: Received command : create site –hosts=desenv-linux2 mysite
2013-12-13 12:19:47.313: (message) [T0x1ebf010 chass]: Handling request id 1
2013-12-13 12:19:47.313: (critical) network-mysqld.c:2043: left the MySQL protocol’s state-machine at state ‘CON_STATE_READ_QUERY’. You may see the connection hang now.

item.title: By: Oracle Announces New Release of MySQL | Caped Crusaders Tech
item.dc:creator: Oracle Announces New Release of MySQL | Caped Crusaders Tech
item.description: [...] which is also GA in version 1.1.4, which fully supports the MySQL 7.2 GA. Check out their Cluster Manager and their blog article on Synchronously Replicating Databases Across Data [...]
item.content:encoded: […] which is also GA in version 1.1.4, which fully supports the MySQL 7.2 GA.  Check out their Cluster Manager and their blog article on Synchronously Replicating Databases Across Data […]
